item.title: Sarah add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "The Expulsion from Paradise is eternal in its principal aspect: this makes it irrevocable, and our living in this world inevitable, but the eternal nature of the process has the effect that not only could we remain forever in Paradise, but that we are currently there, whether we know it or not." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Erich Fromm
item.description: "Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties." -- Erich Fromm

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "If you believe in peace, act peacefully; if you believe in love, acting lovingly; if you believe every which way, then act every which way, that's perfectly valid - but don't go out trying to sell your beliefs to the system. You end up contradicting what you profess to believe in, and you set a bum example. If you want to change the world, change yourself." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "This is a hell of dull talk...How about some of that champagne?" -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "A sense of humor...is superior to any religion so far devised." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "I believe in everything; nothing is sacred. I believe in nothing; everything is sacred. Ha Ha Ho Ho Hee Hee." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ben Lee
item.description: "Every twelve seconds someone remembers that we are all in this together." -- Ben Lee

item.title: Sarah add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Life is difficult. This is a great truth, one of the greatest truths. It is a great truth because once we truly see this truth, we transcend it. Once we truly know that life is difficult-once we truly understand and accept it-then life is no longer difficult. Because once it is accepted, the fact that life is difficult no longer matters." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Sarah add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "It is only because of problems that we grow mentally and spiritually. " -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "All religions are true but none are literal." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Half the people in the world think that the metaphors of their religious traditions, for example, are facts. And the other half contends that they are not facts at all. As a result we have people who consider themselves believers because they accept metaphors as facts, and we have others who classify themselves as atheists because they think religious metaphors are lies." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Wherever the poetry of myth is interpreted as biography, history, or science, it is killed." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The man who reads nothing at all is better educated than the man who reads nothing but newspapers." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Erich Fromm
item.description: "The quest for certainty blocks the search for meaning. Uncertainty is the very condition to impel man to unfold his powers. " -- Erich Fromm

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "The unhappy person resents it when you try to cheer him up, because that means he has to stop dwelling on himself and start paying attention to the universe. Unhappiness is the ultimate form of self-indulgence. When you're unhappy, you get to pay a lot of attention to yourself. You get to take yourself oh so very seriously." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Let us live for the beauty of our own reality." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "Root out the violence in your life, and learn to live compassionately and mindfully. Seek peace. When you have peace within, real peace with others is possible." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "Drink your tea slowly and reverently, as if it is the axis on which the world earth revolves - slowly, evenly, without rushing toward the future." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Hardly a pure science, history is closer to animal husbandry than it is to mathematics in that it involves selective breeding. The principal difference between the husbandryman and the historian is that the former breeds sheep or cows or such and the latter breeds (assumed) facts. The husbandryman uses his skills to enrich the future, the historian uses his to enrich the past. Both are usually up to their ankles in bullshit." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by kurt vonnegut
item.description: "If I should ever die, God forbid, let this be my epitaph: THE ONLY PROOF HE NEEDED FOR THE EXISTENCE OF GOD WAS MUSIC" -- kurt vonnegut

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr
item.description: "Dear future generations: Please accept our apologies. We were rolling drunk on petroleum." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Those people who recognise that imagination is reality's master, we call sages, and those who act upon it, we call artists." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Leop­ards break in­to the tem­ple and drink all the sac­ri­fi­cial ves­sels dry; it keeps hap­pen­ing; in the end, it can be cal­cu­lat­ed in ad­vance and is in­cor­po­rat­ed in­to the rit­ual." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Elizabeth Edwards
item.description: "The days of our lives, for all of us, are numbered...We know that. And yes, there are certainly times when we aren't able to muster as much strength and patience as we would like. It's called being human. But I have found that in the simple act of living with hope, and in the daily effort to have a positive impact in the world, the days I do have are made all the more meaningful and precious. And for that I am grateful." -- Elizabeth Edwards
